author: A D
text:
As many as 518 teachers have been arrested for staging a road roko here on Saturday. They insisted on a 15-point demand including the cancellation of Contributory Pension Scheme.

Joint Action Committee of Teachers’ Organisations called for this state wide protest. In Tiruvannamalai the road roko was held in front of the taluk office. Ragu, district secretary of Tamil Nadu Graduate Teachers’ Association led the protest.

Other demands

Other demands include hiking the grade pay of secondary grade teachers from Rs.2,800 to Rs.4,200; lift the Teachers Eligibility Test conducted to recruit teachers and to make Tamil as compulsory subject in Tamil Nadu. Large numbers of teachers were recruited on consolidated pay between 2004 and 2006 and later their services were regularised. Now one of the demands of the protesters was to consider the period as their regular service.
title: 518 teachers held for road roko
